answers.answer: The A1C is far more accurate than the fasting.  And 5.3 is pretty good.  I would request and A1C three months after the first, just to see if you are still on track.

tobywankenobi....  (very cute handle, by the way!)You've got a lot going on medically...  have you asked your docs why your blood glucose seems to fluctuate so much?  The liver plays a big role in blood glucose regulation, so maybe that's the reason?  Plus, all the meds you are on could play a factor.  I would ask the docs who told me to get my blood sugar under control how they suggest I would do that... maybe a referral to an endocrinologist or diabetes specialist?  Sounds like you have a number of medical issues going on and need to have your full team of docs giving you some more specific feedback and guidance.Best wishes, and please post updates about what your docs tell us (that would be helpful for all of us!)

question: I have three different physicians right now two of them say that I need to have my blood sugar under control, my psychiatrist and my liver doctor. They have all done blood work and told me to give the results to my PCP, whose bloodwork on me comes back normal.........I see my PCP the least amount of times. Why does my glucose fluctuate so much? I have Bi-polar, Stage 3 liver disease, Arthritis of the spine, and Hypertesion!!! My meds are Seroquel, Lithium, Inderal, Lisinopril, Ultram, Klonopin, and Nxium along with 81mg of aspirin. My glucose levels have been recorded as high as 165 (fasting) by Labs (Quest) and 245 by my home meter!!!! Diabeties 2 is in my family from my mothers side.........What should I do????? I am supposed to start Interferon/Ribivirin sometime this month!!! Thank you for you feedback!!!! Last bloodwork from my pcp was115 glucose and 5.3 HGB A1C......Peace
